Itineraries.name: Kangra Painting
Itineraries.caption: Krishna playing a flute
Itineraries.desc: Kangra painting is the pictorial art of Kangra, named after Kangra, Himachal Pradesh, a former princely state, which patronized the art.

Itineraries.name: Ashoka Pillar
Itineraries.caption: Indian culture
Itineraries.desc: Kochi (also known as Cochin) is a city in southwest India's coastal Kerala state. It has been a port since 1341, when a flood carved out its harbor and opened it to Arab, Chinese and European merchants.

Itineraries.name: Konark Elephant
Itineraries.desc: Kanyakumari is a coastal town in the state of Tamil Nadu on India's southern tip. Jutting into the Laccadive Sea, the town was known as Cape Comorin during British rule and is popular for watching sunrise and sunset over the ocean.
